member.name: T:Leadtools.Jpeg2000.CompositeJpxImages
member.summary: CompositeJpxImages specifies the layer color, opacity, pre-multiplied opacity, and compression information.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Jpeg2000Engine class.

member.name: M:Leadtools.Jpeg2000.Jpeg2000Engine.AppendBox(System.IO.Stream,Leadtools.Jpeg2000.Jpeg2000SingleBox)
member.summary: Appends a single box to a JPEG 2000 data stream. This method is available in the Document/Medical Toolkits.
member.param: A System.IO.Stream containing the JPEG 2000 file data.
Jpeg2000SingleBox object containing the box data being appended.

member.name: M:Leadtools.Jpeg2000.Jpeg2000Engine.AppendBox(System.String,Leadtools.Jpeg2000.Jpeg2000SingleBox)
member.summary: Appends a single box to a JPEG 2000 file. This method is available in the Document/Medical Toolkits.
member.param: System.String containing the name of the JPEG 2000 file.
Jpeg2000SingleBox object containing the box data being appended.

member.name: M:Leadtools.Jpeg2000.Jpeg2000Engine.AppendBoxes``1(System.IO.Stream,List<``0>)
member.summary: Appends multiple boxes to a JPEG 2000 data stream. This method is available in the Document/Medical Toolkits.
member.param: A System.IO.Stream containing the JPEG 2000 file data.
A list of Jpeg2000MultiBox objects containing the box data being appended.

member.name: M:Leadtools.Jpeg2000.Jpeg2000Engine.AppendBoxes``1(System.String,List<``0>)
member.summary: Appends multiple boxes to a JPEG 2000 file. This method is available in the Document/Medical Toolkits.
member.param: System.String containing the name of the JPEG 2000 file.
A list of Jpeg2000MultiBox objects containing the box data being appended.

member.name: M:Leadtools.Jpeg2000.Jpeg2000Engine.AppendFrames(Leadtools.Codecs.RasterCodecs,System.IO.Stream,Leadtools.Jpeg2000.CompositeJpxImages,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Appends new frames to a currently existing JPEG 2000 stream. This method is available in the Document/Medical Toolkits.
member.param: The Leadtools.Codecs.RasterCodecs object.
A System.IO.Stream to which the new frame data will be saved.
List of CompositeJpxImages containing the layer image data being appended.

Resulting file's pixel depth. Possible values are: 8, 12, 16, 24, 32, 48, 64, and 0. A value of zero \[0\] means that each image will be saved with its bits per pixel value, if that value is equal to one of the possible values (8, 12, 16, 24, 32, 48, or 64).

Quality factor. This value determines the degree of loss in the compression process. Possible values are from 0 to 255. A value of zero (0) represents lossless compression. Values between 1 and 255 are interpreted as a compression ratio.

member.name: M:Leadtools.Jpeg2000.Jpeg2000Engine.AppendFrames(Leadtools.Codecs.RasterCodecs,System.String,Leadtools.Jpeg2000.CompositeJpxImages,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Appends new frames to a currently existing JPEG 2000 file. This method is available in the Document/Medical Toolkits.
member.param: The Leadtools.Codecs.RasterCodecs object.
System.String containing the name of the file to which the new frames are being appended.
List of CompositeJpxImages containing the layer image data that will be appended.

Resulting file's pixel depth. Possible values are: 8, 12, 16, 24, 32, 48, 64, and 0. A value of zero \[0\] means that each image will be saved with its bits per pixel value, if that value is equal to one of the possible values (8, 12, 16, 24, 32, 48, or 64).

Quality factor. This value determines the degree of loss in the compression process. Possible values are from 0 to 255. A value of zero (0) represents lossless compression. Values between 1 and 255 are interpreted as a compression ratio.

member.param: A System.IO.Stream containing the JPEG 2000 file data to which the GML data is being appended.
GmlData object containing the GML information being appended.

GmlData object containing the GML information being appended.

member.name: M:Leadtools.Jpeg2000.Jpeg2000Engine.ExtractFrames(System.String,System.String,List<int>)
member.summary: Extracts the specified frames from the input file, and saves them to a new JPEG 2000 file. This method is available in the Document/Medical Toolkits.
member.param: System.String containing the name of the JPEG 2000 file from which the frames are being extracted.
System.String containing the name of the JPEG 2000 file to be used to save the extracted frames. This file will contain only the extracted frames.
Frame indices. A list of integers specifying the indices of the frames to be extracted from the input file. All indices should be 0-based.

member.name: M:Leadtools.Jpeg2000.Jpeg2000Engine.ExtractFramesMemory(System.IO.Stream,List<int>)
member.summary: Extracts the specified frames from the input stream, and saves them to a new JPEG 2000 file in a byte array. This method is available in the Document/Medical Toolkits.
member.param: A System.IO.Stream containing the JPEG 2000 file data from which the frames are being extracted.
Frame indices. A list of integers specifying the indices of the frames to be extracted from the input file. All indices should be 0-based.
member.returns: A byte array that contains a JPEG 2000 file with extracted frames only.

member.name: M:Leadtools.Jpeg2000.Jpeg2000Engine.ExtractFramesMemory(System.String,List<int>)

member.param: System.String containing the name of the JPEG 2000 file from which the frames are being extracted.
Frame indices. A list of integers specifying the indices of the frames to be extracted from the input file. All indices should be 0-based.
member.returns: A byte array that contains a JPEG 2000 file with only the extracted frames.

Frame indices. A list of integers specifying the indices of the frames to be extracted from the input stream. All indices should be 0-based.
member.returns: A Leadtools.RasterNativeBuffer object that contains a JPEG 2000 file with only the extracted frames.

member.param: System.String containing the name of the JPEG 2000 file from which the frames are being extracted.
Frame indices. A list of integers specifying the indices of the frames to be extracted from the input file. All indices should be 0-based.
member.returns: A Leadtools.RasterNativeBuffer object that contains a JPEG 2000 file with only the extracted frames.

member.name: M:Leadtools.Jpeg2000.Jpeg2000Engine.Load(Leadtools.Codecs.RasterCodecs,System.IO.Stream,System.Int32,Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsLoadByteOrder)
member.summary: Loads the specified JPEG 2000 image stream using the specified options.
member.param: The Leadtools.Codecs.RasterCodecs object.
A System.IO.Stream containing the image data to be loaded.
Resulting image pixel depth. If this value is zero \[0\], the image will have the original file's pixel depth (the image will not be converted).

Color order for 16-bit, 24-bit, 32-bit, 48-bit, and 64-bit images. If the resulting image is less than 16 bits per pixel, this will have no effect since palletized images do not use color order. Possible values are:
member.returns: The Leadtools.RasterImage object that this method loads.

System.String containing the name of the JPEG 2000 image file being loaded.
Resulting image pixel depth. If this value is zero \[0\], the image will have the original file's pixel depth (the image will not be converted).

Color order for 16-bit, 24-bit, 32-bit, 48-bit, and 64-bit images. If the resulting image is less than 16 bits per pixel, this will have no effect since palletized images do not use color order. Possible values are:
member.returns: The Leadtools.RasterImage object that this method loads.

A System.IO.Stream containing the image data being loaded.
Resulting image pixel depth. If this value is zero \[0\], the image will have the original file's pixel depth (the image will not be converted).

Color order for 16-bit, 24-bit, 32-bit, 48-bit, and 64-bit images. If the resulting image is less than 16 bits per pixel, this will have no effect since palletized images do not use color order. Valid values are as follows:
member.returns: The CompositeJpxImages list that this method loads.

member.name: M:Leadtools.Jpeg2000.Jpeg2000Engine.LoadComposite(Leadtools.Codecs.RasterCodecs,System.String,System.Int32,Leadtools.Codecs.CodecsLoadByteOrder)
member.summary: Loads the specified JPEG 2000 image files (that is CompositeJpxImages.ColorImage, CompositeJpxImages.OpacityImage, and CompositeJpxImages.PreOpacityImage) using the specified options.
member.param: The Leadtools.Codecs.RasterCodecs object.
System.String containing the name of the JPEG 2000 image file being loaded.
Resulting image pixel depth. If this value is zero \[0\], the image will have the original file's pixel depth (the image will not be converted).

Color order for 16-bit, 24-bit, 32-bit, 48-bit, and 64-bit images. If the resulting image is less than 16 bits per pixel, this will have no effect since palletized images do not use color order. The following are valid values:
member.returns: The CompositeJpxImages list that this method loads.

Frame indices. A list of integers specifying the indices of the frames to be loaded from the stream.
Resulting image pixel depth. If this value is zero \[0\], the image will have the original file's pixel depth (the image will not be converted).

Color order for 16-bit, 24-bit, 32-bit, 48-bit, and 64-bit images. If the resulting image is less than 16 bits per pixel, this will have no effect since palletized images do not use color order. Valid values are as follows:
member.returns: The CompositeJpxImages list that this method loads.

member.param: The Leadtools.Codecs.RasterCodecs object.
System.String containing the name of the JPEG 2000 image file which has the frames being loaded.
Frame indices. A list of integers specifying the indices of the frames to be loaded from the file.
Resulting image pixel depth. If this value is zero \[0\], the image will have the original file's pixel depth (the image will not be converted).

Color order for 16-bit, 24-bit, 32-bit, 48-bit, and 64-bit images. If the resulting image is less than 16 bits per pixel, this will have no effect since palletized images do not use color order. Valid values are as follows:
member.returns: The CompositeJpxImages list that this method loads.

member.name: M:Leadtools.Jpeg2000.Jpeg2000Engine.ResetEngineBoxes
member.summary: Resets all of the boxes for the JPEG 2000 engine.

member.name: M:Leadtools.Jpeg2000.Jpeg2000Engine.Save(Leadtools.Codecs.RasterCodecs,System.IO.Stream,Leadtools.RasterImage,Leadtools.Jpeg2000.Jpeg2000FileFormat,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Saves a Leadtools.RasterImage to a stream in any of the supported JPEG 2000 file formats. This method is available in the Document/Medical Toolkits.
member.param: The Leadtools.Codecs.RasterCodecs object.
A System.IO.Stream where the image data will be saved.
The Leadtools.RasterImage object that holds the image data.
Output JPEG 2000 file format. For valid values, refer to Jpeg2000FileFormat.

Resulting file's pixel depth. Possible values are: 8, 12, 16, 24, 32, 48, 64, and 0. A value of zero \[0\] means that each image will be saved with its bits per pixel value, if that value is equal to one of the possible values (8, 12, 16, 24, 32, 48, or 64).

Quality factor. This value determines the degree of loss in the compression process. Possible values are from 0 to 255. A value of zero (0) represents lossless compression. Values between 1 and 255 are interpreted as a compression ratio.

member.name: M:Leadtools.Jpeg2000.Jpeg2000Engine.Save(Leadtools.Codecs.RasterCodecs,System.String,Leadtools.RasterImage,Leadtools.Jpeg2000.Jpeg2000FileFormat,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Saves a Leadtools.RasterImage to a file in any of the supported JPEG 2000 file formats. This method is available in the Document/Medical Toolkits.
member.param: The Leadtools.Codecs.RasterCodecs object.
System.String containing the name of the file currently being saved.
The Leadtools.RasterImage object that holds the image data.
Output JPEG 2000 file format. For valid values, refer to Jpeg2000FileFormat.

The resulting file's pixel depth. Possible values are: 8, 12, 16, 24, 32, 48, 64, and 0. A value of zero \[0\] means that each image will be saved with its bits per pixel value, if that value is equal to one of the possible values (8, 12, 16, 24, 32, 48, or 64).

Quality factor. This value determines the degree of loss in the compression process. Possible values are from 0 to 255. A value of zero (0) represents lossless compression. Values between 1 and 255 are interpreted as a compression ratio.

member.name: M:Leadtools.Jpeg2000.Jpeg2000Engine.SaveComposite(Leadtools.Codecs.RasterCodecs,System.IO.Stream,Leadtools.Jpeg2000.CompositeJpxImages,Leadtools.Jpeg2000.Jpeg2000FileFormat,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Saves a CompositeJpxImages list to a stream in any of the supported JPEG 2000 file formats. This method is available in the Document/Medical Toolkits.
member.param: The Leadtools.Codecs.RasterCodecs object.
A System.IO.Stream to which the image data will be saved.
List of CompositeJpxImages layer image data that will be saved
Output JPEG 2000 file format. For valid values, refer to Jpeg2000FileFormat.

Resulting file's pixel depth. Possible values are: 8, 12, 16, 24, 32, 48, 64, and 0. A value of zero \[0\] means that each image will be saved with its bits per pixel value, if that value is equal to one of the possible values (8, 12, 16, 24, 32, 48, or 64).

Quality factor. This value determines the degree of loss in the compression process. Possible values are from 0 to 255. A value of zero (0) represents lossless compression. Values between 1 and 255 are interpreted as a compression ratio.

member.name: M:Leadtools.Jpeg2000.Jpeg2000Engine.SaveComposite(Leadtools.Codecs.RasterCodecs,System.String,Leadtools.Jpeg2000.CompositeJpxImages,Leadtools.Jpeg2000.Jpeg2000FileFormat,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Saves a CompositeJpxImages list to a file in any of the supported JPEG 2000 file formats. This method is available in the Document/Medical Toolkits.
member.param: The Leadtools.Codecs.RasterCodecs object.
System.String containing the name of the file currently being saved.
List of CompositeJpxImages containing the image layer data that will be saved.
Output JPEG 2000 file format. For valid values, refer to Jpeg2000FileFormat.

Resulting file's pixel depth. Possible values are: 8, 12, 16, 24, 32, 48, 64, and 0. Zero \[0\] means that each image will be saved with its bits per pixel value, if that value is equal to one of the possible values (8, 12, 16, 24, 32, 48, or 64).

Quality factor. This value determines the degree of loss in the compression process. Possible values are from 0 to 255. A value of zero (0) represents lossless compression. Values between 1 and 255 are interpreted as a compression ratio.

member.name: M:Leadtools.Jpeg2000.Jpeg2000Engine.SetBox(Leadtools.Jpeg2000.Jpeg2000FileFormat,Leadtools.Jpeg2000.Jpeg2000SingleBox)
member.summary: Sets a single box for the JPEG 2000 engine.
member.param: Jpeg2000FileFormat specifying the JPEG 2000 engine.
Jpeg2000SingleBox object containing the box data being set.

member.name: M:Leadtools.Jpeg2000.Jpeg2000Engine.SetBoxes``1(Leadtools.Jpeg2000.Jpeg2000FileFormat,List<``0>)
member.summary: Sets a list of boxes for the JPEG 2000 engine.
member.param: Jpeg2000FileFormat specifying the JPEG 2000 engine.
A list of Jpeg2000MultiBox objects containing the box data being set.

member.name: M:Leadtools.Jpeg2000.Jpeg2000Engine.Dispose
member.summary: Overloaded. Releases all resources used by this Jpeg2000Engine.

member.summary: Overloaded. Releases all resources used by this Jpeg2000Engine.
member.param: true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.

member.summary: This member overrides Finalize.

member.name: E:Leadtools.Jpeg2000.Jpeg2000Engine.LoadImage
member.summary: Occurs during the JPEG 2000 file loading process to provide functionality for manually handling the output image data or monitoring the progress status.

member.name: E:Leadtools.Jpeg2000.Jpeg2000Engine.SaveImage
member.summary: Occurs during the JPEG 2000 file saving process to provide functionality for manually handling the output image data or monitoring the progress status.
